items.title: KARYOTYPE
items.description:
• The number and appearance of chromosomes in the nucleus of a eukaryotic cell
  • The term is also used to denote a test that can detect deviations from the normal number and formation of chromosomes.
  • Normally, human cells have 46 chromosomes arranged in 23 pairs.

sections.title: Indications
sections.description:
• Intersex
  • Recurrent Pregnancy loss
  • Azoospermia
  • Amniocentesis and testing of the fluid to detect genetic problems in the baby.
